data.title: Best dinner of our trip (by far)!
data.text: Very small (8 tables or so) but cosy restaurant in Homestead. We ordered the mac 'n cheese and the ribs. Both were outstanding, especially the rib dish with the best brussel sprouts we have ever tasted. Also the host (Will) did a great job serving us. 5 stars well deserved!

data.title: Best food of the whole trip
data.text:
We came because of the reviews and boy we weren't disappointed. The owner's wife bend over backwards to make it possible for us to eat there even though they were full. Make reservations, it's a small place and you're not the first to find out their food is so so finger licking good and the service is brimming with passion. Come with an empty stomach so you can have starters and desserts. 
The only thing I don't like about the place that it's too far from home to make it our new favorite restaurant. We're already planning our return trip from the Keys around a lunch stop here.

data.title: Something new and different
data.text: This place was great and lots of fun.I love garlic and so does the chef.I tried an authentic Puerto Rican dish and my husband had the"burger" (there are 17 different burgers) and plenty of gluten free choices.everything was cooked to perfection.We will go back again!!

data.title: Doesn't look like much on outside, but inside is a world apart
data.text:
My husband and I have eaten here a few times for dinner and lunch - and we will be eating there more with family and friends now that we've found it.  Eclectic local artwork on walls, interesting characters waiting tables, and heavenly gourmet food for reasonable prices, accompanied by an out of the ordinary collection of beers and wines.  Menus change daily, but there are always hamburgers of various sorts at lunch and several tempting appetizers and entrees at dinner.  Only drawback is lack of adequate parking and adequate space for more diners once many more have discovered this place.  In fact, I ought to say bad things about it so there would be always enough space for us, but I won't, because it really is worth finding!
.

data.title: Awesome
data.text: All I have to say is A1 food in an authentic setting. The food is worth every cent that they charge.

data.title: The Best Food in Homestead!
data.text: Stopped in with a friend after searching Trip Advisor for suggestions. Wanted to try something other than the chain restaurants in the area. It was a great decision as we were not disappointed!! The waitress was very friendly and helpful in explaining the choices. The restaurant was small, clean and comfortable. I had  possibly the best blue cheese burger with brisket and bacon I've ever had and she had the mofongo and a chimichurri steak which she too loved! We've sent friends there since and will be back next time we are in the area. Had a nice chat with the owner after we ate as well and got some business cards to share our new favorite place!  Thank you guys!!.

data.title: Cozy Restaurant with Delicious Food
data.text: We have been to Chefs on the Run many times.  The food is very good and service friendly. The restaurant is cozy and is decorated with artwork from local artists (that is for sale).   They now serve wine and beer so you do not need to bring your own anymore.

data.title: Try lunch and dinner!!!
data.text:
This place has a different menu for lunch and dinner. That is great so you can have two awesome experiences. 

It is a small local restaurant with great quality and kind and helpful service. For lunch you cannot miss the hamburger, best in town and probably in miles around. 
For dinner you have different options and all look great, but the Churrasco is amazing.

Don't miss the opportunity to go high quality in a cozy and sweet atmosphere.

data.title: Wonderful Place!
data.text: Trip advisor lead us to this small but excellent place!  The habanero chicken is mouthwatering great!

data.title: Stop Running Chef You're Home
data.text:
Chefs on the Run is the best place in Homestead.  The food is top notch!  In a town that doesn't have very many options in the way of good restaurants Chefs on the Run feels more like a South Miami top choice. 

It's fusion flavors with some Hispanic and Asian flings make everything good and choosing your entree very difficult. 

Things you should know before you go.  Their schedule is short bus special. My first three attempts were met by closed doors. Check online to make sure they are open.  Also, it's not a very large place. Bring your patience because you can count the tables on you hands.

data.title: Beer tasting
data.text: Been here a few times for the wine tasting and got the wine glasses to prove it. Had to try their beer. My favorite was the Gator Tail!!

data.title: Horrible Customer Service
data.text:
At any business customer service is just as important as the quality of the food and products providing.  We went to this restaurant to venture into our hometown, looking for a good place to eat.  Let's  admit it, homestead is not known for wonderful restaurants.  This place is no different.  With only 8 tables, 3 where open.  We stood at the door way for a few minutes, while the guy in the front was on the phone.  There is no sign to sit yourself or to wait to be seated.  Eventually we went to sit ourselves.  The 1 waitress was a tad rude and told us to wait to be seated.   Ok, so we overlooked the waitress deminer and went back to the entrance to wait.  At his point we figured it would be fast.  To our surprise we waited over 5 more minutes and still did not get acknowledged.

If people are at your restaurant willing to spend there money then the least you can do is give them a decent greeting, which we didn't get.  The guy on the phone simply just walked away into the kitchen, and the waitress never came to get us. My spouse decided that we should leave. For a restaurant the size of a single bedroom,  and a greeting area the size of a personal restroom, 5 minutes is 1 minute too long.  

My advice is to greet your customers, let them sit or sit them and let them know you will be with them shortly.  This way, they feel acknowledged and believe it or not it is an unspoken gratitute for their business.  As we were walking out the door, the chef popped his head out the kitchen window, and i said " I really wanted to try your food, but you should get better servers."

Needless to say, we will never return or try the food here.  The first impression is a lasting one.  The experience was unwarranted based on the size of the restaurant.  Instead we walked right over to Toro Taco next door and enjoyed a friendly family atmosphere, and a decent meal.

data.title: Descent
data.text: My husband liked it. I am vegetarian and their dinner menu was limited for my diet. It would be nice if they had more vegetarian dinner options- I would try this place again if they did. I found what they did offer to be slightly bland but that could've been the nature of the dish...

data.title: Not terrible...just hot!
data.text: On a recent visit to Homestead, we found this place online and were intrigued by the menu so we made dinner reservations for our group of 7.  When we called to make the reservation, we appreciated that the owner took the time to inform us the restaurant was small.  We were excited to try the cuisine of Puerto Rico so the size of the restaurant didn't matter to us.  That being said, however, it would have been even more helpful to know in advance that the air conditioning worked minimally, if at all...including the portable, freestanding A/C unit that didn't seem to help matters. The food was ok.  Perhaps it would have tasted better if we hadn't been so overheated while eating?  Kudos for the best dish, the ahi, which was quite good. Regretfully, the Argentinian Churrasco wasn't memorable; the Mongolian Pork was salty beyond belief and the Guava Yaba Chicken had one note:  sweet.  The beer selection seemed to be limited to 4-5 different (and overpriced) bottled craft beer selections.  Our server was very friendly and incredibly, unbelievably energetic (which was no small feat given the lack of A/C on a steamy August evening).

data.title: Good Food
data.text: The food was very flavorful. I would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for more flavorful food in Homestead Florida

data.title: Good food
data.text:
The food at this place was good. I ordered the ribs with Mac n Cheese, which was good. Unfortunately the ribs didn't have so much great meat on it. It was a lot of fat. But the meat that was there was great. 
We also had the Captain & Shrimp dish, which tasted great! 
However, the place is small so expect some wait to get a table. But the wait is worth it.

data.title: If you like Cuban.... (the menu changes)
data.text:
The menu varies regularly, so take this as a review of their current menu.  The food is very fresh and the ingredients are of the highest quality. However, I found the short ribs to be very average, meaning that they were just a piece of stew meat.  I prefer to not go out and spend a fair amount on a piece of meat that has been boiled to oblivion.  (I guess I'm not a fan of Cuban cuisine, although I love Havana '59 in Richmond, VA) 

One waiter was very knowledgable about the menu, but he was also very loud, which was difficult to tolerate.  The dining room is very cramped, but they squeeze as many in as possible.  I did find it reminiscent of European dining in that we stayed from 7 to close (10) and didn't feel pressured to leave.  

In sum, check the menu before you commit and make sure they're serving something you want.  If they are, it will be very fresh and delicious.

data.title: Jeff and Jean Manners
data.text: Awesome, unique food, great service, authentic atmosphere. Great experience. Will return again and again. Welcome to the new Homestead.

data.title: Excellent cuisine and service
data.text: From the moment we stepped into this cozy restaurant the service was second to none. The food was exceptional and thoroughly enjoyed. As I am gluten and diary intolerant it is sometimes difficult to find a restaurant who caters to my needs, Will went out of his way to make sure I had the choice of a range of side dishes and the ribs he recommended were delicious. He was so knowledgeable and a real Ambassador for the Restaurant. The Chef even made a point to speak to us.  Both men were very passionate about what they do. Highly recommended.

data.title: Best burgers!
data.text: This restaurant is very small if you go it's best to make reservations. Although they have many entrees on the menu, their burgers are the best I have ever eaten. Their brisket burger is the best! In the heart of Homestead it is a restaurant not to be missed.
